Records|Warner Bros.]], [[Machine Shop Recordings|Machine Shop]] | Producer = [[Brad Delson]], [[Mike Shinoda]] |Writer = [[Linkin Park]], [[Rakim|William Griffin]] | Chronology = [[Linkin Park]] singles | Last single = "[[A Light That Never Comes]]"
(2013) | This single = "'''Guilty All the Same'''"
(2014) | Next single = "[[Until It's Gone (Linkin Park song)|Until It's Gone]]"
(2014) | Misc = {{Extra chronology | Artist = [[Rakim]] singles | Type = single | Last single = "[[The Seventh Seal (Rakim album)|Walk These Streets]]"

{{YouTube|cEaEdLQbAFM|"Guilty All the Same" (Lyric Video)}}}} }} "'''Guilty All the Same'''" is a song by American [[rock music|rock]] band [[Linkin Park]]. The song was originally recorded by the band for their sixth studio album, ''[[The Hunting Party (album)|The Hunting Party]]''. The track features American rapper [[Rakim]] from the [[golden age hip hop]] duo [[Eric B. & Rakim]]. The track premiered on March 6, 2014 on commercial mobile service [[Shazam (service)|Shazam]],{{cite web|last=Montgomery|first=James|title=Surprise! Linkin Park Drop New Single 'Guilty All The Same'|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1723619/linkin-park-new-single-rakim.jhtml|work=MTV.com|publisher=MTV|accessdate=6 March 2014}} and was released as a [[single (music)|single]] by [[Warner Bros. Records]] on March 7, 2014. The song was self-produced since the band decided not to have a producer for the album.{{cite web|last=Shinoda|first=Mike|title=First Linkin Park 2014 Studio Update|url=http://mikeshinoda.com/2014/02/03/first-linkin-park-2014-studio-update/|work=MikeShinoda.com|publisher=MikeShinoda|accessdate=6 March 2014}} ==Recording and composition== {{Listen | filename = Guilty All The Same.ogg | title = "Guilty All The Same" | description = A 30 second sample of the second verse and chorus of "Guilty All The Same". | pos = left }} In an interview with Radio.com, Shinoda and Bennington explained that this song "''...seemed like the perfect song to reintroduce the band.''"{{cite web|title=Interview: Linkin Park On Their New Single ‘Guilty All The Same’|url=http://news.radio.com/2014/03/05/linkin-park-guilty-all-the-same-interview/|work=News.Radio.com|publisher=Radio.com|accessdate=6 March 2014}} {{cquote|"A few months ago I was making some demos and writing this stuff and it sounded like something that you could play on the radio," Shinoda explained. "I listen to a lot of [[indie rock|indie]] music… and I was listening to the demos and thought, I don't want to make any of that music. What is it that's not out there right now that I'm all about, that I'm fired up about that is a void? It ended up being this new material."}} In that same interview, regarding the addition of Rakim, Shinoda wanted to surprise people and was "spitballing" the idea of getting Rakim, one of Shinoda's idols growing up, on the track. When the band's engineer revealed that he knew one of Rakim's people, he reached out to him, leading to Rakim coming over to the studio and, according to Bennington, "crush that section" (verse over the bridge). Shinoda was originally going to rap in the bridge off the song, but thought that it would be too predictable and wanted another rapper to do it instead, and managed to get into contact with Rakim through their musical engineer.{{cite web|last=Iandoli|first=Kathy|title=Mike Shinoda of Linkin Park Talks Rakim Collaboration, Says He's On The "Kendrick Got Robbed" Team From The Grammy's|url=http://www.hiphopdx.com/index/videos/id.15811/title.mike-shinoda-of-linkin-park-talks-rakim-collaboration-says-he-s-on-the-kendrick-got-robbed-team-from-the-grammy-s|work=Hiphopdx.com|publisher=HipHopDX|accessdate=18 March 2014}} The track features a long instrumental intro and is driven by aggressive guitars and drums, with lead singer [[Chester Bennington]] using primarily melodic yet harsh vocals, while guest rapper Rakim raps his own verse over a [[hip hop music|hip hop]]-tinged bridge.{{cite web|last=Kaufman|first=Spencer|title=Linkin Park Unleash New Single ‘Guilty All the Same’ Featuring Rakim|url=http://loudwire.com/linkin-park-new-single-guilty-all-the-same-featuring-rakim/|work=Loudwire.com|publisher=Loudwire|accessdate=6 March 2014}} Alternatively, it has been described as demonstrating a [[rap metal]] style similar to that of the band's earlier albums, ''[[Hybrid Theory]]'' and ''[[Meteora (album)|Meteora]]'' by ''[[Music Feeds]]''.{{cite web |url=http://musicfeeds.com.au/news/linkin-park-drop-surprise-new-single-guilty-all-the-same/ |title=Linkin Park Drop Surprise New Single ‘Guilty All The Same’ |publisher=Music Feeds |date=March 6, 2014 |accessdate=March 6, 2014}} It has also been described as a return to their [[hard rock]] and [[heavy metal music|heavy metal]] roots for the band by Zach McEntire of [[KXRK]].{{cite web|author=Zach McEntire|url=http://www.x96.com/6_new_albums_you_need_to_hear_this_summer/blog/562 |title=6 New Albums You Need To Hear This Summer |publisher=X96 |date= |accessdate=2014-06-15}} [[Al Kooper]] observed it as "plain old heavy metal".{{cite web|last=Kooper |first=Al |url=http://www.themortonreport.com/entertainment/music/new-music-for-old-people-nrbq-janiva-magness-passenger-carla-thomas-and-more/ |title=New Music for Old People: NRBQ, Janiva Magness, Passenger, Carla Thomas and More |publisher=The Morton Report |date=2014-06-20 |accessdate=2014-07-04}} ==Reception== Tarun Mazumdar of ''[[International Business Times]]'' gave the song a positive review, claiming "the vocals nicely compliment the entire instrumentation", and praises Rakim's rapping during the breakdown.{{cite web|last=Mazumdar|first=Tarun|url=http://au.ibtimes.com/articles/542226/20140307/linkin-park-guilty-same.htm#.UxpTiT9dU0k |title=Music Review: Linkin Park Release New Single ‘Guilty All The Same’ Through Shazam - International Business Times |publisher=Au.ibtimes.com |date= |accessdate=2014-03-07}} Andy Walsh at Renowned for Sound gave the song 3.5 out of 5 stars, calling the heaviness of the song a "welcome return". He concludes with hoping it's a sign for things to come.{{cite web|last=Walsh |first=Andy |url=http://renownedforsound.com/index.php/single-review-linkin-park-guilty-all-the-same/ |title=Single Review: Linkin Park – ‘Guilty All The Same’ |publisher=Renowned for Sound |date=2014-03-21 |accessdate=2014-05-06}} In the track by track review by ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'', the song is given a positive response and explained as "The fellas are justifiably psyched to have hip-hop legend Rakim on this track, so they preface his arrival with more than a minute of dramatic guitar buildup. At first, the bobbing and weaving riffage suggests a boxer readying for the bell, but then the group segues into quasi-symphonic metal mode, and we're galloping into Bennington's verses."Partridge, Kenneth (6-18-2014)[http://www.billboard.com/articles/review/6121623/linkin-park-the-hunting-party-track-by-track-review-mike-shinoda "Linkin Park's 'The Hunting Party': Track-by-Track Review"] ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' June 18, 2014. Retrieved June 20, 2014 ==Music video== The music video for "Guilty All the Same" is a collaboration between Linkin Park and Microsoft's ''[[Project Spark]]'', giving the fans the opportunity of editing it and remixing it as they will. In Linkin Park's version of the game, the protagonist is a character haunted by guilt. The player navigates the character through a dark, slightly sinister environment that threatens to devour him as he tries to flee from the forces of his own guilt. The level resembles a mashup between the racing mechanic of ''[[Temple Run]]'', and the noir art style of ''[[Badland (video game)|Badland]]''. The better the player performs, the richer the soundtrack for the song.{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5944909/linkin-park-s-new-video-is-a-game-inside-look-at-guilty-all-the-same |title=Linkin Park's New Video is a Game: Inside Look at 'Guilty All the Same' |publisher=Billboard |date= |accessdate=2014-03-31}}{{cite web|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q3jO_sVQ5io |title=LINKIN PARK's Guilty All the Same (Nerdist News) |publisher=YouTube |date=2014-03-24 |accessdate=2014-03-31}} ==Track listing== {{Track listing | headline = Digital download{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/guilty-all-same-feat.-rakim/id835625229 |title=iTunes - Music - Guilty All the Same (feat. Rakim) - Single by LINKIN PARK |publisher=Itunes.apple.com |date=2014-03-07 |accessdate=2014-03-31}} | writing_credits = yes | extra_column = Producer(s) | title1 = Guilty All the Same | note1 = featuring [[Rakim]] | writer1 = [[Linkin Park]], [[Rakim|William Griffin]] | extra1 = [[Brad Delson]], [[Mike Shinoda]] | length1 = 5:55 }} {{Track listing | headline = US Promotional single | writing_credits = yes | extra_column = Producer(s) | title1 = Guilty All the Same | note1 = radio edit | writer1 = Linkin Park | extra1 = Delson, Shinoda | length1 = 3:52 }} ==Personnel== ;Linkin Park * [[Chester Bennington]] – [[lead vocals]] * [[Rob Bourdon]] – [[Drum kit|drums]], [[Percussion instruments|percussion]] * [[Brad Delson]] – [[lead guitar]] * [[Dave Farrell|Dave "Phoenix" Farrell]] – [[bass guitar]], [[backing vocals]] * [[Joe Hahn]] ("Mr. Hahn") – [[Turntablism|turntables]], [[Sampling (music)|samples]], [[Programming (music)|programming]] * [[Mike Shinoda]] – backing vocals, [[rhythm guitar]], keyboards ;Additional musicians * [[Rakim]] - [[rap vocals]] ==Charts== {{col-begin}} {{col-2}} ===Weekly charts=== {|class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- ! scope="col"| Chart (2014) ! scope="col"| Peak
